intro: Trigonella multinervis, commonly known as the multivened fenugreek, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its trifoliate leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with slender stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three leaflets that are often hairy and have a distinct venation pattern. The seeds are enclosed in narrow, elongated pods and are used in traditional medicine and as a spice in some cuisines.
